results.title: Springboard techniques: the forward and backward lifts
results.brief_description: A prerequisite for skilful diving is a thorough understanding of the functions of the springboard in diving. Stop-motion and slow motion are used in this film to give a detailed analysis of lifts, tucks, somersaults, and other types of diving movements, both in training for diving, and in actual dives by experts.

results.title: Spring in Japan
results.brief_description: It was believed that the spirits of the gods made flowers their home, therefore the coming of Spring and the blooming of the flowers is an important time in Japan. Camellias and cherry blossom are representative of all Japanese flowers, and are in evidence during the traditional festivals. Shows the making of elaborate dolls for the Doll Festival.
results.description: It was believed that the spirits of the gods made flowers their home, therefore the coming of Spring and the blooming of the flowers is an important time in Japan. results.title: Spring comes to Sweden
results.brief_description: Poetic impression of the coming of spring to the Swedish countryside, captured in visual terms without commentary. As the sun’s rays strengthen, the snowmelts and drop by drop streams trickle together forming as they gather rushing torrents cascading to the sea. Migrating birds return to Sweden, boys fly kites on the windy hillsides, wildflowers bloom on the forest floor and blossoms appear on trees, for spring has come to Sweden once more.

results.title: Spring comes to Kashmir
results.creator_credit: Ravi Prakash, Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A panorama of spring in the mountains of Kashmir. The melting snows and running streams; the herders taking their beasts up to pastures; work beginning in the fields; smartening up the river boats for tourists; the gardens and orchards.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ravi Prakash, Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Spring's wild splendours
results.creator_credit: Norman G. Green and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Springtime, the wildflower season in Western Australia. Among the many flowering shrubs and plants are everlasting, leschenaultia, hovea, quandong, kangaroo paws and Sturt’s desert pea as well as the Christmas tree, several species of banksia and flowering eucalyptus.

results.title: Spring
results.brief_description: Provides a series of visual impressions illustrating spring. Shows bare trees bursting into leaf, buds into flower and a profusion of colour appearing in gardens. No narration.

results.title: Spotty: the fawn in winter
results.brief_description: Shows Spotty the fawn as he sees his first snow in the forest, and describes how a little girl who puts out food for the animals helps Spotty survive his first winter.
